   <link href="index_long.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
   <script language="Javascript1.2">
    // Set the message for the alert box
 am = "WARNING: You are not Authorized  to copy this page - ÂŠ Copyright Wehrmacht-Awards.com LLC";
 
 // do not edit below this line
 // ===========================
 bV  = parseInt(navigator.appVersion)
 bNS = navigator.appName=="Netscape"
 bIE = navigator.appName=="Microsoft Internet Explorer"
 
 function nrc(e) {
    if (bNS && e.which > 1){
       alert(am)
       return false
    } else if (bIE && (event.button >1)) {
      alert(am)
      return false;
    }
 }
 
 document.onmousedown = nrc;
 if (document.layers) window.captureEvents(Event.MOUSEDOWN);
 if (bNS && bV<5) window.onmousedown = nrc;
   </script>
  </head>
  <body>
   <div id="links">
    <a href="iron_cross/ironcrossmain.htm">
     Iron Cross
     <span>
      First Class, Second Class, Knights Cross and Oak Leaves series
     </span>
    </a>
    <a href="war_merit_cross/war_merit_cross_main.htm">
     War Merit Cross
     <span>
      War Merit Medal, War Merit Cross Second/First Class and Knights Cross to the War Merit Cross
     </span>
    </a>
    <a href="german_cross/german_cross_main.htm">
     German Cross
     <span>
      A very detailed study of the German Cross
     </span>
    </a>
    <a href="war_badges/war_badges_main.htm">
     War Badges
     <span>
      War and Qualification Badge of the Wehrmacht
     </span>
    </a>
    <a href="campaign_awards/campaign_awards_main.htm">
     Campaign Awards
     <span>
      Cufftitles and medals presented for Wehrmacht campaigns
     </span>
    </a>
    <a href="service_awards/service_awards_main.htm">
     Service Awards
     <span>
      Service awards including Honor Awards and Wound Badges
     </span>
    </a>
    <a href="uniforms_firearms/index.htm">
     Uniforms &amp; Firearms
     <span>
      Uniforms, Equipment and Firearms of the Wehrmacht
     </span>
    </a>
    <a href="documents/documents.htm">
     Documents
     <span>
      Wehrpass, Soldbuch and compilation of award documents sections
     </span>
    </a>
    <a href="related/related.htm">
     Related Militaria
     <span>
      Axis Allies, Ribbon bars and political militaria
     </span>
    </a>
    <a href="reserach_tools/index.htm">
     Collector's Tools
     <span>
      Black Light, Ranks, Book List, LDO chart, Ribbon Charts, and other on-line tools.
     </span>
    </a>
    <a href="association/index.htm">
     Association Area
     <span>
      Members only area
     </span>
    </a>
    <a href="misc/forum.htm">
     Discussion Forum
     <span>
      Seeking more information?  Visit our lively discussion forum
     </span>
    </a>
   </div>
   <div id="content" style="position: absolute; left: 164px; top: 25px">
    <div align="center">
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="border" width="100%">
      <tr>
       <td>
        <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
         <tr>
          <td height="96" width="344">
           <img alt="" height="96" src="fusion_header_logo.gif" width="344"/>
          </td>
          <td height="96" style="background-image:fusion_header_ls.gif)" width="100%">
           <img alt="" height="96" src="fusion_header_ls.gif" width="100%"/>
          </td>
          <td height="96" width="407">
           <img alt="" height="96" src="fusion_header_rs.gif" width="407"/>
          </td>
         </tr>
        </table>
        <p>
        </p>
        <p>
         Wehrmacht-Awards.com is an entity focused on the awards, decorations and militaria of the
           German Armed Forces during the Third Reich era.
        </p>
        <p>
         Within the pages of this project you will find construction methods, 
 manufacturing characteristics, and detailed specifications of vital interest to 
 every collector.  Yet the site offers more than technical information; by 
 presenting recipient biographies and delving into the historical atmosphere of 
 the era, the reader is able to better understand
           and appreciate the experiences of
           the men who charged into battle for Germany throughout World War
           II.
        </p>
        <p>
         The website currently spans over 400 pages and  includes a 
 comprehensive catalog of Wehrmacht militaria, which can be browsed with the 
 navigation bar to the left.
        </p>
        <p>
        </p>
        <div align="center">
         <center>
